meanings.definition: A musical instrument with a pear-shaped body and a curved neck, used in the Middle Ages and Renaissance.
meanings.sent1: The musicians played beautiful melodies on their rebecs.
meanings.sent2: During the Renaissance fair, the minstrel entertained the crowd with his rebecs.
meanings.sent3: The rebecs at the medieval banquet seemed to have a mind of their own, joining in the festivities.
meanings.sent4: The rebecs' haunting tunes echoed through the castle halls, enchanting all who listened.
meanings.sent5: The intricate carvings on the rebecs made them look like magical instruments from a fairy tale.

meanings.definition: The plural form of the word 'rebec', referring to more than one of these instruments.
meanings.sent1: In the music shop, there was a display of various rebecs for sale.
meanings.sent2: The orchestra included multiple rebecs, adding a unique sound to the performance.
meanings.sent3: As the musicians unpacked, a comical mix-up occurred, and they ended up with a pile of rebecs.
meanings.sent4: The rebecs in the ensemble harmonized perfectly, creating a symphony of strings.
meanings.sent5: The room was filled with the enchanting sound of the rebecs, transporting the audience to another era.
